intro: Loncomelos israelense, commonly known as the Israeli stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pink or white, adding ornamental value to gardens. Due to its hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
